  • ELEMENT

com.blockhaus2000.minecraft.util.command

Annotation Type Command


  • @Documented
@Target(value=METHOD)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface Command
    The annotation is used to tag methods, so they will be detected from the CommandManager to register the implemented commands.
    Author:
    Blockhaus2000

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String[] aliases
      The aliases for the command.
      java.lang.String desc
      A short description of this command.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean autoSetMaxOnSyntax
      Enables the auto maximal setting if you use a specific command syntax (sepcified in syntax()).
      java.lang.String[] flags
      The flags for this command.
      java.lang.String help
      A long help for this command.
      int max
      The maximal arguments for this command.
      int min
      The minimum arguments for this command.
      java.lang.String permission
      The permission that is used for this command.
      CommandPriority priority
      The CommandPriority for this command.
      java.lang.String secondLevelCommand
      This is the second-level-command of the command.
      java.lang.String syntax
      This is the syntax of the command.
      java.lang.String usage
      The usage of this command. it can be "/commands arg0 arg1 arg2" or something like this.

    • Element Detail

      • aliases

        public abstract java.lang.String[] aliases
        The aliases for the command. The command will be registered with all of these alisaes, and you can execute with all of these.
        Returns:
        The String[] of the aliases.

      • desc

        public abstract java.lang.String desc
        A short description of this command. Will be shown in "/help".
        Returns:
        A short description for this command.

      • permission

        public abstract java.lang.String permission
        The permission that is used for this command. If the executer does not have the permission, a NoPermissionCommandEvent will be fired and the method will not be invoked. If the permission is an empty String, no permission will be used.

        Default: ""

        Returns:
        The permission for this command.
        Default:
        ""

      • usage

        public abstract java.lang.String usage
        The usage of this command. it can be "/commands arg0 arg1 arg2" or something like this.

        Default: ""

        Returns:
        The usage of this command.
        Default:
        ""

      • min

        public abstract int min
        The minimum arguments for this command. If a uses enter not enough arguments, a NotEnoughArgumentsCommandEvent will be fired and the method will not be invoked.

        Default: 0

        Returns:
        The minimum arguments of this command.
        Default:
        0

      • max

        public abstract int max
        The maximal arguments for this command. If a uses enter too many arguments, a TooManyArgumentsCommandEvent will be fired and the method will not be invoked. If it is -1, you can enter infinite arguments.

        Default: -1

        Returns:
        The minimum arguments of this command.
        Default:
        -1

      • priority

        public abstract CommandPriority priority
        The CommandPriority for this command. If some commands have a same alias, the command with the highest priority will be executed first.

        Default: CommandPriority.NORMAL

        Returns:
        The priority of this command.
        Default:
        com.blockhaus2000.minecraft.util.command.CommandPriority.NORMAL

      • flags

        public abstract java.lang.String[] flags
        The flags for this command. Flags are an efficient way to allow toggles in commands (For example, a user uses -h in his command, the flag will be setted to true). Value flags are also supported. You can enable the with a : after the flag name. If the value is not available, a IllegalSyntaxCommandEvent will be thrown with the type IllegalSyntaxType.UNAVAILABLE_FLAG_VALUE.

        NOTE: Flags have to matches the regex [A-Za-z]:?.

        Returns:
        A String[] of flags for this command.
        Default:
        ""

      • syntax

        public abstract java.lang.String syntax
        This is the syntax of the command. The syntax should sepcify the type-usage for this command (for example String Integer String...). The CommandManager checks for you, that there are enough arguments (otherwise, it should call an event) and parse the argument Strings into Integers or Doubles. With VarArgs, the CommandManager joins the next arguments to a long String. You can seperate the types with a blank ( ) or a comma and a blank (, ). You can also use multiple commas or blanks. It doesnt effect the delimiter system. The delimiter only have to match the regex ,* +. Every other delimiter will build an unavailable type.

        NOTE: If you use this feature, the min/max settings are fully ignored!

        Returns:
        The syntax for this command.
        Default:
        ""

      • secondLevelCommand

        public abstract java.lang.String secondLevelCommand
        This is the second-level-command of the command. So the command method calling will be extended so the second-level-command has to equals the second arguments of the executed command. (for example, this is all and one of the command alisas is kill, /kill all has to be executed o enter the method that is tagged with this annotation).

        NOTE: This will not effect the max. argument setting, the min. argument setting or the command syntax setting! The second-level-command will be removed completly.

        Returns:
        The second-level-command for this command.
        Default:
        ""

      • autoSetMaxOnSyntax

        public abstract boolean autoSetMaxOnSyntax
        Enables the auto maximal setting if you use a specific command syntax (sepcified in syntax()).
        Returns:
        The boolean value that auto maximal setting on syntax specification is enabled.
        See Also:
        syntax()
        Default:
        true

      • help

        public abstract java.lang.String help
        A long help for this command.
        Returns:
        The long help of this command.
        Default:
        ""
